solutions: Check if the battery is charged and connected properly.
Ensure that the fuel tank has enough fuel.
Inspect the spark plugs and ignition system.
Turn off the engine immediately to prevent damage.
Check the coolant level and top it off if needed.
Inspect the radiator and cooling system for leaks.
Check the thermostat and water pump.
Check the brake pads for wear and replace if necessary.
Inspect the brake rotors for any damage.
Apply brake lubricant to prevent squeaking.
If the issue persists, visit a mechanic.
